Ah, if you could please take your seats as quickly as possible that'd be great. Thank you.
Madeleine was a beloved wife, mother, grandmother and friend. And now Mrs Agnes Rosowski, a dear friend and neighbor, will say a few quick words.
OK, so at this point we should conclude today's service with a moment's silence, after which lemonade will be served in the...
I'm sorry, sir we really need to-
Unfortunately sir, we need to be.
A doorbell rings. TJ runs to the door wearing the bottom half a suit. It's the pizza man.
Dad's driving, eating a slice of pizza. TJ is in the backseat, looking out the window, also eating pizza. Mom does her make-up in the visor mirror.
Teej, c'mon sweetheart. We have to go.
We'll eat it in the car.
Honey, will you grab the present?
That's a great idea. I'll be sure to let them know that our dirty old microwave is a gift from you.
A microwave and a bottle of scotch is hardly a lot of presents.
Sure honey. How about some oldies?
Kill it! There's someone in the car!
What the hell are you doing?
What were you doing in there?
This car's about to get crushed. If I didn't see you, you would be dead.
I did not know Madeleine long enough, but from the moment I moved into the neighborhood so many years ago, she treated me as though I was part of the family.
Madeleine always had open arms and welcomed friends as kindly as her own.

We shared so many wonderful walks and enjoyed each other's company very much. I will miss our walks. I will miss our talks and most of all, I will miss Madeleine. I will always remember what she told me, life is like walking in the rain, you can either hide and take shelter or you can just get wet. She was dear to me and she will always have a place in my heart.
TJ, I think you should say something.
You'll get him to bed now, won't you?
